Articles.Content:
Where exactly are they coming from?

I mean they can't all possibly live at the space center... Where is Kerbopolis?

And who designed rocket engines capable of not-exploding when the average kerbal has the IQ of a rock ?

Seriously, according to the game Kerbin is 5 times denser than lead and the Kerbol shouldn't even shine...

KSP is KSP, there's no need for logic or thinking in this game, it's not like it's rocket science !

Oh, wait...
Sounds like it's time for the Hitchhiker's Guide to Kerbals to do a stunning expose on the subject...

Apparently Kerbals have incredibly advanced civilisation. It allows them to actively explore the space, while keeping their homeworld in (almost) pristine shape. To achieve this goal, they live in vast, underground cities. KSC is the only constantly inhabitated structure built on the surface. Only recently kerb-government decided space program advanced sufficiently to allow untrained civillians to go to space (for a small, operational fee).

> 
> Sounds like it's time for the Hitchhiker's Guide to Kerbals to do a stunning expose on the subject...

"Harmless Mostly Harmless"

Tourists and all other kerbals are generated by the engine as needed. theres no lore for kerbal cities or storylines its not that kind of game. they come and go as you click the accept button nothing more nothing less.
I wonder what it would take to randomly spawn Kerbals on the surface every so often, kind of like the VAB/SPH crew, having picnics and stuff, maybe give 'em old-school Cadillacs or something...

> 
> Sounds like it's time for the Hitchhiker's Guide to Kerbals to do a stunning expose on the subject...

This, for kerbals involved in more boring stuff like finance or politic an suborbital trajectory to the sun is high status. 

The public response to the first cosmonauts returning from Mun, Minmus and Duna made the planetary president envious.

Personally, I consider tourists stats to be Courage and Richness, instead of Courage and Intelligence. I think it brings more fun to tourism contracts... ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Tourists = A way to pay for missions I want done without having to sell blood for funds.
